verses.kjv: Then Jerubbaal, who is Gideon, and all the people that were with him, rose up early, and pitched beside the well of Harod: so that the host of the Midianites were on the north side of them, by the hill of Moreh, in the valley.
verses.ct: Jerubbaal (that is, Gideon) and all his men got up early and set up camp beside the spring of Harod. The Midianite army was camped north of them, near the hill of Moreh in the valley.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Gideon, The people that are with thee are too many for me to give the Midianites into their hands, lest Israel vaunt themselves against me, saying, Mine own hand hath saved me.
verses.ct: The LORD told Gideon, "You have too many soldiers with you for me to give you victory over the Midianites. Israel might take the credit away from me and say, 'We saved ourselves by our own strength.'"

verses.kjv: Now therefore go to, proclaim in the ears of the people, saying, Whosoever is fearful and afraid, let him return and depart early from mount Gilead. And there returned of the people twenty and two thousand; and there remained ten thousand.
verses.ct: "So announce to the troops: 'Whoever is scared or afraid should leave and head home from Mount Gilead.'" So 22,000 men went home, and 10,000 stayed.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Gideon, The people are yet too many; bring them down unto the water, and I will try them for thee there: and it shall be, that of whom I say unto thee, This shall go with thee, the same shall go with thee; and of whomsoever I say unto thee, This shall not go with thee, the same shall not go.
verses.ct: But the LORD told Gideon, "There are still too many. Take them down to the water, and I will sort them out for you there. When I tell you, 'This one goes with you,' he will go. And when I tell you, 'This one doesn't go with you,' he won't go."

verses.kjv: So he brought down the people unto the water: and the LORD said unto Gideon, Every one that lappeth of the water with his tongue, as a dog lappeth, him shalt thou set by himself; likewise every one that boweth down upon his knees to drink.
verses.ct: So Gideon brought the men down to the water. The LORD told him, "Separate everyone who laps the water with his tongue the way a dog does from everyone who gets down on his knees to drink."

verses.kjv: And the number of them that lapped, putting their hand to their mouth, were three hundred men: but all the rest of the people bowed down upon their knees to drink water.
verses.ct: The number who lapped water from their hands to their mouths was 300 men. All the rest got down on their knees to drink.

verses.kjv: And the LORD said unto Gideon, By the three hundred men that lapped will I save you, and deliver the Midianites into thine hand: and let all the other people go every man unto his place.
verses.ct: The LORD told Gideon, "With these 300 men who lapped, I will rescue you and give you victory over the Midianites. Send everyone else home."

verses.kjv: So the people took victuals in their hand, and their trumpets: and he sent all the rest of Israel every man unto his tent, and retained those three hundred men: and the host of Midian was beneath him in the valley.
verses.ct: So the 300 took the food and trumpets from the others. Gideon sent the rest of the Israelites back to their tents but kept the 300 men. The Midianite camp was below him in the valley.

verses.kjv: And it came to pass the same night, that the LORD said unto him, Arise, get thee down unto the host; for I have delivered it into thine hand.
verses.ct: That night the LORD said to him, "Get up and go down to the enemy camp, because I have given you victory over them."

verses.kjv: But if thou fear to go down, go thou with Phurah thy servant down to the host:
verses.ct: "But if you're afraid to go down, take your servant Phurah with you to the camp."

verses.kjv: And thou shalt hear what they say; and afterward shall thine hands be strengthened to go down unto the host. Then went he down with Phurah his servant unto the outside of the armed men that were in the host.
verses.ct: "Listen to what they're saying, and afterward you'll have the courage to attack the camp." So he went down with his servant Phurah to the edge of the armed forces stationed in the camp.

verses.kjv: And the Midianites and the Amalekites and all the children of the east lay along in the valley like grasshoppers for multitude; and their camels were without number, as the sand by the sea side for multitude.
verses.ct: The Midianites, the Amalekites, and all the eastern peoples were spread across the valley as thick as locusts. Their camels were too many to count, like grains of sand on the seashore.

verses.kjv: And when Gideon was come, behold, there was a man that told a dream unto his fellow, and said, Behold, I dreamed a dream, and, lo, a cake of barley bread tumbled into the host of Midian, and came unto a tent, and smote it that it fell, and overturned it, that the tent lay along.
verses.ct: When Gideon arrived, a man was telling his friend about a dream. He said, "Listen — I had a dream where a round loaf of barley bread came rolling into the Midianite camp. It hit a tent, struck it so hard that the tent collapsed and flipped upside down, completely flattened."

verses.kjv: And his fellow answered and said, This is nothing else save the sword of Gideon the son of Joash, a man of Israel: for into his hand hath God delivered Midian, and all the host.
verses.ct: His friend replied, "That can only be the sword of Gideon son of Joash, the Israelite. God has handed Midian and this entire army over to him."

verses.kjv: And it was so, when Gideon heard the telling of the dream, and the interpretation thereof, that he worshipped, and returned into the host of Israel, and said, Arise; for the LORD hath delivered into your hand the host of Midian.
verses.ct: When Gideon heard the dream and its meaning, he bowed in worship. Then he went back to the Israelite camp and said, "Get up! The LORD has given you victory over the Midianite army!"

verses.kjv: And he divided the three hundred men into three companies, and he put a trumpet in every man’s hand, with empty pitchers, and lamps within the pitchers.
verses.ct: He split the 300 men into 3 groups and gave each man a trumpet and an empty clay jar with a torch inside it.

verses.kjv: And he said unto them, Look on me, and do likewise: and, behold, when I come to the outside of the camp, it shall be that, as I do, so shall ye do.
verses.ct: He told them, "Watch me and do exactly what I do. When I reach the edge of the camp, copy whatever I do."

verses.kjv: When I blow with a trumpet, I and all that are with me, then blow ye the trumpets also on every side of all the camp, and say, The sword of the LORD, and of Gideon.
verses.ct: "When I and everyone with me blow our trumpets, then you blow your trumpets too from every side of the camp and shout, 'For the LORD and for Gideon!'"

verses.kjv: So Gideon, and the hundred men that were with him, came unto the outside of the camp in the beginning of the middle watch; and they had but newly set the watch: and they blew the trumpets, and brake the pitchers that were in their hands.
verses.ct: Gideon and his 100 men reached the edge of the camp at the start of the middle watch, right after the guards had been changed. They blew their trumpets and smashed the jars they were holding.

verses.kjv: And the three companies blew the trumpets, and brake the pitchers, and held the lamps in their left hands, and the trumpets in their right hands to blow withal: and they cried, The sword of the LORD, and of Gideon.
verses.ct: All 3 groups blew their trumpets and shattered their jars. They held the torches in their left hands and the trumpets in their right hands, and they shouted, "A sword for the LORD and for Gideon!"

verses.kjv: And they stood every man in his place round about the camp; and all the host ran, and cried, and fled.
verses.ct: Each man held his position around the camp. The entire enemy army panicked, screaming as they ran away.

verses.kjv: And the three hundred blew the trumpets, and the LORD set every man’s sword against his fellow, even throughout all the host: and the host fled to Bethshittah in Zererath, and to the border of Abelmeholah, unto Tabbath.
verses.ct: When the 300 blew their trumpets, the LORD caused the soldiers throughout the camp to turn their swords against each other. The army fled toward Bethshittah in the direction of Zererath, all the way to the border of Abelmeholah near Tabbath.

verses.kjv: And the men of Israel gathered themselves together out of Naphtali, and out of Asher, and out of all Manasseh, and pursued after the Midianites.
verses.ct: Israelite men from the tribes of Naphtali, Asher, and all of Manasseh were called up, and they chased after the Midianites.

verses.kjv: And Gideon sent messengers throughout all mount Ephraim, saying, Come down against the Midianites, and take before them the waters unto Bethbarah and Jordan. Then all the men of Ephraim gathered themselves together, and took the waters unto Bethbarah and Jordan.
verses.ct: Gideon also sent messengers throughout the hill country of Ephraim, saying, "Come down to fight the Midianites and seize the water crossings ahead of them as far as Bethbarah and the Jordan." So all the men of Ephraim assembled and captured the water crossings as far as Bethbarah and the Jordan.

verses.kjv: And they took two princes of the Midianites, Oreb and Zeeb; and they slew Oreb upon the rock Oreb, and Zeeb they slew at the winepress of Zeeb, and pursued Midian, and brought the heads of Oreb and Zeeb to Gideon on the other side Jordan.
verses.ct: They captured 2 Midianite commanders, Oreb and Zeeb. They killed Oreb at the rock of Oreb and killed Zeeb at the winepress of Zeeb. They continued pursuing the Midianites and brought the heads of Oreb and Zeeb to Gideon on the other side of the Jordan.
